pageContext.claim: “We're bringing our jobs back because of trade deals. We have great trade deals, and jobs are coming back.”
pageContext.analysis: Most of Trump's trade deals have been nibbling at the edges of previous pacts and the record is unclear about whether they will result in additional jobs in the United States. Trump sometimes falsely says he has reduced trade deficits as part of this claim. The huge disparity in labor wages around the world, the relative ease with which companies can relocate or outsource jobs, and the globalized nature of the economy, make it a stretch for him to claim that companies are relocating to the United States because of his trade deals. Foreign investment in the United States grew at a slower annual pace in the first two years of Trump’s tenure than during Barack Obama’s presidency,
